divs: Sighting DetailsI was walking the dog at night ( 9-10pm ) I was facing south and looked up and saw a very red star. I thought, is this thing redder than Betelgeuse? I looked to the right and it was. It was nearly overhead, starlike It slowly changed to white, and I thought, Ok , its twinkling. It was motionless compared to the stars around it. Then it moved slowly to the southwest I said, OK its a plane. but no flashing strobes on the thousands of planes I have seen. OK, if it is a satellite it will move constantly to the south west. I lined it up with 2 stars and it moved southwest (slowly) It became red again It then curved back to the south east and the just to the south I watched it for 3 more minutes until i couldn't see it any more It disappeared in the south (never less than 30 degrees from horizon) It appeared High up. I am an amateur astronomer and have never seem anything I could not identify, ever.
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Woburn
There were no other sightings in Woburn on or around December 24th 2011
Object Flight Path: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
